title: The Holy Family with the Infant Christ Pressing the Wine of the Eucharist

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of linen, wool, silk and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk, slit tapestry weave.

description: With its focus on the infant Christ squeezing grapes to make the Eucharistic wine, this small tapestry probably decorated a private oratory. The outer border of flowers and fruit is a later addition and is less finely woven than the holy figures and the inner border of a single pansy and rosebud.
medium_display: Linen, wool, silk and gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk, slit tapestry weave
credit_line: Bequest of Mr. and Mrs. Martin A. Ryerson
publication_history:
Spitzer 1890-91, 159, no. 2 (Tapisseries).

Sptizer 1893, lot 395.

Hunter 1916, 498-500, fig. II.

Candee 1935, 60-61 (ill. opp. 61).

Christa Charlotte Mayer, Masterpieces of Western Textiles from The Art Institute of Chicago (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1969), 25, 28, plate 12.

Wardwell 1975, 19-21, fig. 3.

Christa C. Mayer Thurman, Textiles in The Art Institute of Chicago (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 1992), 34-5, 144.

Cavallo, Medieval Tapestries (1993), 336, 339, fig. 121.

Koenraad Brosens, editor, Christa C. Mayer Thurman, general editor, European Tapestries in the Art Institute of Chicago, exh. cat. [exhibition: "The Divine Art: Four Centuries of European Tapestries in the Art Institute of Chicago"] (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 2008) 48-55, cat. 4.

Cleland 2011, no. 1.4.
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, Gallery 5, Masterpiece of the Month, Dec. 1938.

Art Institute of Chicago, Masterpieces of Western Textiles, Jan. 25–Mar. 2, 1969.

Art Institute of Chicago, Tapestries from the Permanent Collection, Jun. 30–Sept. 30, 1979.

Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, European Textile Masterpieces from Coptic Times through the 19th Century, Sept. 27, 1989–Jan. 22, 1990.

Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, Textile Masterpieces from the Art Institute of Chicago's Collection, Feb. 17–May 2, 1993.

Art Institute of Chicago, Regenstein Hall, Chicago's Dream: A World's Treasure The Art Institute of Chicago, 1893–1993, Nov. 1, 1993–Jan. 9, 1994.
 
New York, The Metropolitan Museum of Art, Antonio Ratti Textile Center, Early Sixteenth Century Devotional Tapestries, Dec. 13, 1995–Apr. 1, 1996.

Art Institute of Chicago, Regenstein Hall, The Divine Art: Four Centuries of European Tapestry, Nov. 1, 2008–Jan. 4, 2009.

Art Institute of Chicago, Deering Family Galleries, Tapestry rotation, Gallery 238A, Mar. 26-Sept. 27, 2018.
provenance_text: Frédéric Spitzer (died 1890), Paris, to 1890; sold, Chevallier and Mannheim, Paris, Spitzer sale, Apr. 17–June 16, 1893, lot 395, to Marin A. Ryerson, Chicago (died 1932) [by proxy]; by descent to his wife, Caroline Ryerson (born Hutchinson, died 1937), Chicago; bequeathed to the Art Institute, 1937.

input: The Holy Family with the Infant Christ Pressing the Wine of the Eucharist
